page.title: 11TRAFFIC CENSUS.
page.content: On Thursday July 4th, from 10.00 _ 12.00am.a traffic census was conducted at Wrenbury Green and Marbury Green simultaneously.Both Greens are in the centre of the villages at T_junctions. The main road in Wrenbury showed a dominant{traffic flow}which was not evident in Marbury.In Wrenbury the total counted was 197 compared with 51 in Marbury.In both places there were more cars than the total of the other types of vehicle.{Colour,}covered a very wide spread with red, white and blue being most common.In Wrenbury 34 {different makes}were recorded compared with 12 in Marbury. British Leyland and Ford were distributed most frequently. When divided according to {age,}most vehicles were registered 1984/5, (29 in Wrenbury and 12 in Marbury).The oldest vehicle sighted (at Wrenbury) was registered in 1964.
